website_summaries.verdict: This strong, lightweight racquet is fine-tuned for lightning reflexes and high performance.
pros: While this racquet’s fiberglass construction offers impressive durability, it also cuts down on bulk, weighing just 175 grams
This limits the amount of force the user must exert, resulting in fewer errors, sharper swings, and increased confidence
Users found the handle soft and ergonomic as well
cons: This racket is more than twice as expensive than our other choices

customer_reviews.title: I like it. But you can get the walmart version ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it. But you can get the walmart version nearly identical for $20. Wish I had just got that but is a good racket so far
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: 175 g.  Good balance
customer_reviews.text: I play a lot. Have 2 of these racquets. Love them. This one is a great addition to my collection
customer_reviews.author: curt paulson

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This rack it was exactly what I expected it to be. Arrived on time. And I would recommend this item to anyone looking for a new racquetball racket
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE HANDLE
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for a few months and the end of the handle broke. it looks like the 4 staples holding the end of the handle on pulled right through the fiberglass handle. It is now useless and the return date ended on May 15th. I have used a lot of Head racquets, this is the first defective one i have had. Too bad I cant get it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Just Jim

customer_reviews.title: bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Thought it vibrated a little gave me a hint of cheapness but once I played hard with it it gave me a radical edge
customer_reviews.author: Michael lee grindle

customer_reviews.title: Light powerful racket ball racket
customer_reviews.text: Great racket for helping you win a racket ball game... takes the equipment out of the equation for playing well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I can hardly imagine this could be outperformed by any ...
customer_reviews.text: I can hardly imagine this could be outperformed by any other racket. In this price range it is a hidden treasure.
customer_reviews.author: ali65

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Grandson is Sooooo Happy with this racket. It has helped him improve his game.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Schliesmayer

customer_reviews.title: and the Head Radical Edge racket has been the worse product I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I have used Head racquets for decades, starting with my first tennis racket in 1973. I've been playing racquetball since 1980, and the Head Radical Edge racket has been the worse product I've ever owned. Over a period of 15 months, the racket broke 3 time...in the same place on the frame. The first two times I received a replacement one from the warranty (I did like Head's response to my requests in that regard). This third break convinced me to cut my losses. I'm a B+ player, and know enough to be careful. But collisions in a doubles match happen, and this racket seems to be very prone to breaking with any degree of impact.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this racquet however it cracked on me after just three months of weekend warrior use.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Racquet is supposed to be 175gm, but feels when swinging it to be 200gm.
customer_reviews.author: Deb from Springfield, il

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for my boyfriend and he loved it! Arrive on time as well
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: This is a great upper-mid level racket in my opinion. I play once to twice a week and have little need for anything else. Yeah, there's a lot of sexy rackets out there that boast all sorts of things but this racket will leave you with a great look and feel. It'll also leave you with extra money to buy a glove, some glasses, and maybe a pair of Asics Gel Rockets. Just sayin.
customer_reviews.author: @munchmeat81

customer_reviews.title: Good package deal
customer_reviews.text: Change the handle as it becomes slippery even with glove. Plays good but strung a little tight for my feel
customer_reviews.author: Rock
